info.title: Verizon Thingspace Device Messaging API
info.description: If your product, device, machine, gadget or thing can connect to the Internet, it can use the Device Messaging API to easily publish and subscribe to data. Its machine-to-machine (M2M) messaging for the Internet Of Things (IOT) the way it was meant to be.

get.summary: Create a dweet for a thing.
get.description:
To dweet from your thing, simply call a URL like: https://thingspace.io/dweet/for/my-thing-name?key={account}&hello=world

Just replace my-thing-name with a unique name. Thats it!

Any query parameters you add to the request will be added as key-value pairs to the content of the dweet. For example:

https://thingspace.io/dweet/for/my-thing-name?key={account}&hello=world&foo=bar

You can also send any valid JSON data in the body of the request with a POST.

thingspace.io will also respond to JSONP requests with a ?callback= query parameter.

While we recommend using a secure https:// connection, thingspace.io also supports un-secure http:// connections for devices that dont support SSL.

parameters.name: <any>
parameters.description: You can add any combination of name/value pairs in the URL here.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A valid master key for a locked thing.

parameters.name: thing
parameters.description: A unique name of a thing.  This can be something like a GUID, MAC address, IMEI, ESN, etc., but should be unique within the context of your account.

post.summary: Create a dweet for a thing.
post.description:
To dweet from your thing, simply call a URL like: https://thingspace.io/dweet/for/my-thing-name?key={account}&hello=world

Just replace my-thing-name with a unique name. Thats it!

Any query parameters you add to the request will be added as key-value pairs to the content of the dweet. For example:

https://thingspace.io/dweet/for/my-thing-name?key={account}&hello=world&foo=bar

You can also send any valid JSON data in the body of the request with a POST.

thingspace.io will also respond to JSONP requests with a ?callback= query parameter.

While we recommend using a secure https:// connection, thingspace.io also supports un-secure http:// connections for devices that dont support SSL.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The actual content of the payload. Can be any valid JSON string.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A valid master key for a locked thing.

parameters.name: thing
parameters.description: A unique name of a thing.  This can be something like a GUID, MAC address, IMEI, ESN, etc., but should be unique within the context of your account.

get.summary: Read all of the saved dweets (up to last 500) for a thing.
get.description:
To read all the dweets for a thing, you can call:

https://thingspace.io/get/dweets/for/my-thing-name?key={account}

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A valid master or read-only key for a locked thing.

parameters.name: thing
parameters.description: A unique name of a thing.  This can be something like a GUID, MAC address, IMEI, ESN, etc., but should be unique within the context of your account.

get.summary: Read the latest dweet for a thing.
get.description:
To read the latest dweet for a thing, you can call:

https://thingspace.io/get/latest/dweet/for/my-thing-name?key={account}

Note that thingspace.io only holds on to the last 500 dweets over a 24 hour period. If the thing hasnt dweeted in the last 24 hours, its history will be removed.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A valid master or read-only key for a locked thing.

parameters.name: thing
parameters.description: A unique name of a thing.  This can be something like a GUID, MAC address, IMEI, ESN, etc., but should be unique within the context of your account.

get.summary: Listen for dweets from a thing.
get.description:
Sorry, this function uses HTTP chunked responses and cannot be tested here. Try something like: 
curl --raw https://thingspace.io/listen/for/dweets/from/{thing}

The server will keep the connection alive and send you dweets as they arrive, like:

{thing:my-thing-name,created:2014-02-17T01:10:21.901Z,content:{foo:bar}}

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A valid master or read-only key for a locked thing.

parameters.name: thing
parameters.description: A unique name of a thing.  This can be something like a GUID, MAC address, IMEI, ESN, etc., but should be unique within the context of your account.
